title: 108_hr1276
content: The "American Dream Downpayment Act" is also known as the Downpayment Assistance Initiative under the HOME Program. This initiative aims to provide assistance for downpayments on homes, as outlined in the Cranston-Gonzalez National Affordable Housing Act. The Secretary may grant assistance to low-income families for homeownership through downpayment assistance for single-family housing. Eligible families include low-income first-time homebuyers or those with uniformed employees or teachers in the participating jurisdiction. The Secretary provides downpayment assistance to low-income families for homeownership, including first-time homebuyers or those with uniformed employees or teachers in the participating jurisdiction. Eligible individuals must have income not exceeding 115% of the median income of the area, or 150% in high housing cost areas. To be eligible for a grant under this section, a participating jurisdiction must include in its housing affordability strategy a plan for targeted outreach to residents of public housing for downpayment assistance. Families receiving assistance must meet income limitations set at 150 percent of the median income of the area. The Secretary allocates assistance under this section based on a formula considering a jurisdiction's need and prior commitment to homebuyer assistance. Reallocation of funds is done if allocated amounts become available. The Secretary allocates assistance based on need and prior commitment to homebuyer assistance. Reallocation of funds is done if allocated amounts become available, with funds reallocated to other participating jurisdictions according to the established formula. Grants under this section are not subject to certain provisions, but are subject to specific requirements outlined in the legislation. In applying the requirements of subtitle A, references to funds under subtitle A shall refer to amounts for assistance under this section. References to funds allocated under section 217 shall refer to amounts allocated under subsection (d) or (e) of this section. Participating jurisdictions may use funds for administrative costs. $200,000,000 is authorized for fiscal years 2004 and 2005. Authorization of Appropriations: $200,000,000 is authorized for fiscal years 2004 and 2005 for relocation and downpayment assistance under the Cranston-Gonzalez National Affordable Housing Act. The Uniform Relocation Assistance and Real Property Acquisition Policies Act of 1970 does not apply to downpayment assistance under this title.
